intro: Myrcia laevigata var. brunnea, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal and humid forest regions. Due to its adaptability, it can become invasive in some areas outside its native range.
